column2: I need to go to the university for a confirmation of paying for this semester.
If I have a valid residence permit and I give birth, will my child be here illegally?
Where do I find the work permit forms?
What do you mean they don’t accept documents with electronic signatures?
Shit, I left my passport at home.
Where is room 21?
They’re going to deport my wife and there’s nothing I can do.
I only come here to watch people suffer.
I was playing Pokemon and I missed my turn.
What’s the difference between a visa and a residence permit?
So I have to register my stay but there are no consequences if I don’t?
Can I deny giving them my fingerprints?
The lawyer I hired to help me with this is running late.
I can’t go back home for Christmas because I need to wait here for my residence permit decision.
Hey, what are you doing?
You need to go to the end of the line!
Lol, can you do that?
Have you seen this guy?
I’m on a break, come back later.
It’s one ticket per person.
The machine has broken down. There’s another one at the end of this corridor
Do you have all the necessary documents?
I’m not sure…
Here’s a  list of all the documents, make sure you have everything and then come back again. Take another ticket.
Do you have all the necessary documents?
Yes.
Ok, first the application form in two copies?
Here you go.
Four photos?
I have them right here.
Two copies of your passport?
Here they are.
Proof of residence?
Here’s a copy of my apartment rent contract.
Proof of insurance?
Right.
Great. Certificate of no tax arrears?
I’m sorry, what? There was another page there?
Of course. Please make sure you have all the documents before coming here. You can take everything back.
What? What is this, even?
We’re living in the 21st century, why can’t I send you all these documents by e-mail?
Why do I even have to apply for a residence permit in order to live in a country of my choice?
Aren’t we all a global village? Why do I have to go through this madness?
This bureaucratic insanity is both infuriating and humiliating. This has to end!
We must all join forces to make the world a better place, a place with no countries, no borders!
A place where we can all be one people living together happily!
That is my dream!
You make sure you have all the documents and come back again. Take another ticket.
That’s not what I asked for. You make sure you have all the documents and come back again. Take another ticket.

What a beautiful day. Every day is perfect in this wonderful country I’ve just emigrated to. Today I need to go to the immigration office today to apply for my residence permit. I hope everything will go smoothly!
So I’m supposed to go to room 12. I think I need to get a ticket first.
I can’t go in there without a ticket.
I should make sure I have everything ready before I take a ticket.
Oh no, I’m next, I have to hurry!
Wait, that’s the wrong ticket!
I don’t need that.
Wait, that’s not the correct photo format!
There’s no way you haven’t made a mistake when filling in the application form.
You don’t look like yourself in these photos.
Your passport expires in a year, they’re going to deny you the permit.
There’s no postal code in your apartment rent contract.
Your signature looks different on every document.
They surely misspelled your name on the insurance policy.
You don’t earn enough money to cover the costs of your stay.
There’s probably an international criminal with the same name as you.
The lady at room 12 hates you.
The other ticket machine will be broken too.
